title: Business Travel Counsellors: New business hits £7 million, with dynamic packaging also up
text:
Save 
Business Travel Counsellors brought in a total of £7 million of new business this year, the company’s head of sales revealed at the recent ﻿Business Travel mini conference conference. 
Mark Hulme said the company had also seen a growth in the use of its dynamic package system Phenix. 
“Our corporate travel sector continues to go from strength to strength,” Hulme told delegates. 
“In order to grow this even further, we are focusing on the two key areas of how we help you win new business and then how we support you in retaining it. Much of this is down to the service you provide and the way you keep close to your customer, plus the technology that gives you access to the best rates and allows you to be as flexible as possible when arranging corporate travel.” 
Delegates were also given further insight into how they can use Phenix to build their businesses, with the system enabling agents to make more margin through packaging accommodation and flights together, rather than booking them separately in the system. 
Commercial director Kirsten Hughes added that the company was “constantly developing the system with a clear focus to make it work for our corporate agents”.
